If you like to post some (future) predictions for this year with clear date=
s and events, feel free.=A0 If you have advice to Frank and others on how t=
o better interact with their voices and acquire clearer more understandable=
 messages, that would be useful.=A0 And if you'd like to explain further ho=
w I am "wrong" that the world did not end on August 15 as was predicted, pl=
ease do so. But throwing a little tantrum with no constructive criticism do=
esn't really allow much productive conversation, if I may say so.



--- On=
 Sun, 8/16/09, David Koenig <floridajakeblues@...> wrote:

From: Davi=
d Koenig <floridajakeblues@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Calm thyself-a=
gain and again and again.....
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Sunday, Aug=
ust 16, 2009, 8:58 PM






=A0




    
                  RJ .. Please exc=
use me ... you are obviously WRONG ... How's that?

On Sun, Aug 16, 2009 at=
 11:56 PM, David Koenig <floridajakeblues@ gmail.com> wrote:

JR... Wake up=
 !!!!!

On Sun, Aug 16, 2009 at 6:37 PM, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


=












=A0




    
                  Twisting a prediction after the =
fact to fit circumstances is one of the biggest mistakes (or biggest cop-ou=
ts, or biggest lies) a would-be future-teller makes.=A0 The predictions you=
 were touting were for August 15, and included end-of-the-world warning..=
=A0 Trying to say these were correct, but not REALLY for August 15, and not=
 REALLY end-of-the-world stuff, seems like a way to save face, or keep hopi=
ng the messages are real, when in fact, this is another example that they a=
re not.



So from now on, you will no longer hear clear dates and predicti=
ons.=A0 You may hear vague dates and vague predictions if you like, but you=
 will not hear anything that can be confirmed.=A0 Doing so would put you in=
 a position of having to question the verity of the EVP data you collect.=
=A0 And that might lead to abandoning this while area of study.=A0 And we
 =
know you cannot do that.



--- On Sun, 8/16/09, Frank Sumption <purplealie=
ngirl@ gmail.com> wrote:



From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.co=
m>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Calm thyself-again and again and again.....
To: evp-i=
tc@yahoogroups .com


Date: Sunday, August 16, 2009, 3:08 PM






=A0

   =
 
                  =A0Well, it seems the original prediction of the east c=
oast getting clobbered is probably correct. Where=A0I fell down was trying =
to ask questions and getting BS doomsville junk. I knew it's a mistake=A0to=
 ask questions, that like opens the door for the dark dorks. I'm going back=
 to just announcing I'm doing an EVP recording, and just record. They know =
what I'm thinking and what I need to know and who I would like to hear from=
. Asking questions, at least for me, has always lead to problems. I'm not l=
ike others, presumming I'm so smart and know what is=A0talking, and if it's=
 honest, like most of=A0the box experts out there on the web. You know, the=
 ones doing pod casts, radio shows=A0and proclaiming this that and the othe=
r thing. 



=A0
=A0
=A0
=A0Frank-S

 

      


	 
	
	


      
 

      
=

    
    
	
	
	
	


	


	
	
	
	
	






 

      

    
    
	
	 
	
	




=
